intro: Reissantia ferruginea, commonly known as the rusty reissantia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive rust-colored stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from pink to red. Native to tropical regions of South America, it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
